publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-277 Mr Brian Monteith: Stirling's Appeal to Secure William Wallace Portrait—That the Parliament commends the efforts of Stirling’s Smith Art Gallery and Museum to secure a rare 17th century portrait of William Wallace originally owned by the Wauchopes of Niddrie Marischal, Edinburgh; notes that the gallery has launched an appeal to raise £20,000 to purchase the picture from a private collection in London, and believes that, if this is successful, the portrait would greatly enhance the Smith’s permanent collection of Wallace artefacts, as well as forming an integral part of its major exhibition to commemorate the 700th anniversary of the death of Wallace, scheduled to be held in summer 2005.
S2M-277 Stirling's Appeal to Secure William Wallace Portrait (lodged on 26 August 2003) Phil Gallie*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-277 Stirling's Appeal to Secure William Wallace Portrait (lodged on 26 August 2003) Ms Sandra White*

S2M-277 Stirling's Appeal to Secure William Wallace Portrait (lodged on 26 August 2003) Linda Fabiani*, Alex Johnstone*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Richard Lochhead*, Mike Pringle*, Murdo Fraser*, Alex Neil*
S2M-277 Stirling's Appeal to Secure William Wallace Portrait (lodged on 26 August 2003) Robin Harper*, Mr Keith Raffan*, John Scott*, Colin Fox*
S2M-277 Stirling's Appeal to Secure William Wallace Portrait (lodged on 26 August 2003) Margaret Mitchell*
S2M-277 Stirling's Appeal to Secure William Wallace Portrait (lodged on 26 August 2003) Dr Jean Turner*
